result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jacob R. Scotty
Current: 417 Maple St., Rib Lake, WI 54470 United States  (Effective: 09-25-2017)
Prior: N7199 Second Street, Medford, WI 54451

Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and read in Case No.Nos. 16CM94, 15CM92, 16CM119, 16CM78 and 16TR717.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Case No. 16FO293.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders $583.50.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Stichert and defendant.  Court orders sentence withheld probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to S.N. and M.F.;  counseling as deemed appropriate by probation and comply with a psychiatric evaluation and comply with any recommendations.  Court orders that 16FO293 be added to current payment plan with payments increasing to $50.00 a month beginning February 1, 2016.  -rt
Defendant's Notice of Motion, Motion for Discovery and Inspection and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob R. Scotty in court with attorney Damon P. Stichert.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant.   Attorney Stichert waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond continued.  - rt
Defendant Jacob R. Scotty not in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a body only warrant.   Court orders a body only warrant.  - rt
Victim request and order to remove no contact from Defendant's bond

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with A.L.S. dob: 9-28-1985.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with A.L.S. dob: 9-28-1985.

ADR began at 2:03:26   Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob R. Scotty appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty indicated that defendant has pending cases.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with A.L.S.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders $250.00 cash bond and $250.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with A.L.S.   Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is October 25, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  ADR ended at 2:15:41 pm.  - rt
